alert.note: Alert for Bristol; Southeast Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Bristol, eastern Providence and northern Bristol Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 515 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Swansea, or near East Providence, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Brief heavy downpours could lead to localized minor street flooding. Locations impacted include... Fall River, East Providence, Bristol, Somerset, Barrington, Swansea, Westport, Seekonk, Rehoboth, Warren, Freetown, Dighton and Berkley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.
